name: Master Key
desc: A heavy greatsword with a razor-sharp blade. Power is a key that can open almost any lock.

value.text: Upon causing an Elemental Reaction, increases Elemental Mastery by <color=#37ffff>60/75/90/105/120</color> for 12s. Moonsign: Ascendant Gleam: Elemental Mastery from this effect is further increased by <color=#37ffff>60/75/90/105/120</color> . This effect can be triggered even if the equipping character is off-field.

customize.name: Master Key
customize.desc: A heavy greatsword with a razor-sharp blade. Power is a key that can open almost any lock.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Borderland Claymore Billet
customize.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.

In terms of the "state" of the many weapons that can be crafted from billets, while their potential has long been contained within the original materials, the exact forms these weapons will ultimately take remain unknown to this day...

customize.name: Rainbowdrop Crystal
customize.desc:
A crystal that gives off an iridescent glow. Exceptionally tough and malleable, it has been regarded by Snezhnayan craftspeople as the best forging material since ancient times.
It is believed that when the moon's chariot was shattered, its blood-stained axle-tip fell into the earthly realm beneath the moon, transforming into an iridescent crystal. From that day on, the people of this land no longer worshipped the dead gods. The survivors who knew what the monarchs of the night died for, however, still futilely sing those long-forgotten names.

customize.name: White Iron Chunk
customize.desc: Skilled hands can make this into something brilliant.

customize.name: Diagram: Master Key
customize.desc: A blueprint recreated by Lyulka based on legends and stories. Learn it and you can restore Master Key (Claymore).

customize.name: Serenity's Call
customize.desc: A longsword forged from metal that makes a mournful sound when swung.

customize.name: Prospector's Shovel
customize.desc: A polearm that appears to have been crafted from a metal agricultural tool. At first glance, it could not look more ordinary, yet its discreet design hides fittings that are both lavish and undeniably exquisite.

customize.name: Blackmarrow Lantern
customize.desc: A lantern that emits a faint, ghostly glow, contained by a midnight-black alloy that resembles interlocking bones. It is said to have once been revered as a precious treasure by a certain secret organization.

customize.name: Snare Hook
customize.desc: The stave of this bow is comprised of metal alloy and yet remains surprisingly light. Even when faced with thick, heavy snares, the arrows it fires can pass through unhindered.

desc.text:
No secret remains forever hidden, for even in the darkest and most of secret of rooms, negligence will always leave a crack.
No matter its complexity or brilliance, a lock is vulnerable from the moment of its creation,
Just as even the most meticulous plan is bound to sow the seeds of its own failure.
To the young woman who claimed to be the successor of a master thief, secrets and mechanisms were but mere games.
Neither the proud gentry of the north, nor the sycophantic merchants along the borderland,
Could build an unpickable locks to match her skill.
The more intricate a design is, the more fragile its construction.
With enough pressure, no lock can hold forever.
And so, as the notoriety of the "Bladebreaker" blazed across the land, Schanzkowska, the peasant's daughter, became lost to all memory in time.
The girl who claimed the mantle of a fae lord pilfered countless treasures, her laughter ringing through the dim extravagance with the abandon of a genuine noble.
What should have remained to be a mundane, uninspired life, untouched by any spark, changed dramatically one day when a voice suddenly rang out:
"My dear young lady, oh proud and ridiculous imposter, I'm guessing you're the first person to see this news."
"The Grand Duke's so-called treasure is of no interest to me. You may have it, my dear, just as you have claimed the mantle of that master thief..."
"But do remember: I was the first to break this mechanism. Let my name be etched into your heart, a name you will remember forever, alongside your failure."
The Grand Duke's dinner banquet had been a blatant provocation to thieves everywhere, for the secret treasure on display was impossible to steal, or so he boasted.
The young lady, scoffing at the arrogance, vowed to make away with his treasure in what would be one last heist before her retirement.
But someone had beaten her to the punch. The thief, who went by the "Escape Artist," had left a taunting message on the wall, and its sting left her seething with fury — as well as humiliation.
What followed were countless grudging contests, each one ending in a humbling defeat.
The lockpicking skills the young woman once prided herself were found constantly wanting in her rivalry with this unseen nemesis.
The more she failed, the more her shame burned, and the more she hungered to meet the one who kept beating her.
This went on until one day, the infuriating rival who always left her red with rage vanished without a trace.
Subsequently, word reached her that this thief had been caught and executed.
For reasons she could not explain, she found herself at the rambling graves, unearthing the stone coffin containing the prisoner's body.
But when she dug it up and looked inside, she found that the body was gone. All that remained was a mocking sentence, etched in the cold stone.
Wiping away tears she couldn't quite explain, the young woman cursed her longtime foe's cunning through clenched teeth.
As always, she swore to dedicate her life to uncovering the truth behind his faked death and, once and for all, outwitting him.
In the end, time claimed both the beauty she once flaunted and the final breath she held.
Bereft of the strength to pick even a simple lock, the woman cursed his name one last time before resting inside the empty coffin.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Sundered Glory of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
It is told that in the years before the country of gold and white stone sank, the moon-worshipping ancestors were guided by the star of dawn to build a tower reaching to the heavens.
Later on, the most transgressive of wild fantasies, one to unify life and the world into one, one that even the monarch who ruled all nations on earth failed to achieve, was toppled along with the city in the wrath of the high heavens.
The homeless survivors fled to the south by the waning light of the Frostmoon, chanting in tears of a glory that belonged to them millennia ago.

materials.name: Lightless Bone
materials.desc:
A dull piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is a fragment from the exoskeleton of a monster infused with the ancient power of the moon. Along with the vanished light, it has also lost the secrets once hidden within.

materials.name: Broken Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The drive shaft of a Landcruiser destroyed in battle.
Even the most precise craftsmanship cannot withstand excessive wear, just as the most lofty ideals cannot bring back those who've died in vain for someone else's cause. Moreover, mass-produced components can hardly be called precise, and mass-produced ideals can hardly be considered true ideals.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Unyielding Delusion of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The grand city of gold and white stone was no more. Following the moonlight's pale guidance, its exiled inhabitants wandered to a desolate foreign land.
The glory and prowess of the past had dried up like morning dew, yet the earliest delusion still flowed beneath the skin of the proud, unlike the graves now lost to time.
Like farmers breeding their crops, the Archpriestesses who served the moonlight, for generation after generation, selected the purest bloodlines closest to their progenitors, no matter the cost...

materials.name: Lightless Bone
materials.desc:
A dull piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is a fragment from the exoskeleton of a monster infused with the ancient power of the moon. Along with the vanished light, it has also lost the secrets once hidden within.

materials.desc:

Even the most precise craftsmanship cannot withstand excessive wear, just as the most lofty ideals cannot bring back those who've died in vain for someone else's cause. Moreover, mass-produced components can hardly be called precise, and mass-produced ideals can hardly be considered true ideals.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Unyielding Delusion of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
The grand city of gold and white stone was no more. Following the moonlight's pale guidance, its exiled inhabitants wandered to a desolate foreign land.
The glory and prowess of the past had dried up like morning dew, yet the earliest delusion still flowed beneath the skin of the proud, unlike the graves now lost to time.
Like farmers breeding their crops, the Archpriestesses who served the moonlight, for generation after generation, selected the purest bloodlines closest to their progenitors, no matter the cost...

materials.name: Glowing Remains
materials.desc:
A faintly glowing piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is the remains of an exoskeleton in which a vestige of the ancient power of the moon still lingers. It emanates a deep hue that still lingers long after being separated from its body, steeped as it is in the power of the moon.

materials.name: Reinforced Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The reinforced drive shaft of a Landcruiser.
It took countless reports of destruction to bring about this insignificant improvement. In a sense, the administrative system of the Royal Armory Palace is several times more complex than the machinery it builds. After all, even the most advanced Landcruisers don't take months or even years to build.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Oblation of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A blade as pure as moonlight is the compassion of a benevolent hand.
In the name of mercy, all beings offer hope for tomorrow. Even those looking to be made whole can feel the moonlight's pristine blessing flowing beneath their skin. Even the smallest blessings, accumulated, can guide the pious scions immersed in them closer to the coming Elysium.
All sins and wicked thoughts are cleansed by the pristine moonlight, all tears and suffering are necessary sacrifices — at least that is what the people who worship the moon once firmly believed.

materials.name: Glowing Remains
materials.desc:
A faintly glowing piece of bone taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
It is the remains of an exoskeleton in which a vestige of the ancient power of the moon still lingers. It emanates a deep hue that still lingers long after being separated from its body, steeped as it is in the power of the moon.

materials.name: Reinforced Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The reinforced drive shaft of a Landcruiser.
It took countless reports of destruction to bring about this insignificant improvement. In a sense, the administrative system of the Royal Armory Palace is several times more complex than the machinery it builds. After all, even the most advanced Landcruisers don't take months or even years to build.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Oblation of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
A blade as pure as moonlight is the compassion of a benevolent hand.
In the name of mercy, all beings offer hope for tomorrow. Even those looking to be made whole can feel the moonlight's pristine blessing flowing beneath their skin. Even the smallest blessings, accumulated, can guide the pious scions immersed in them closer to the coming Elysium.
All sins and wicked thoughts are cleansed by the pristine moonlight, all tears and suffering are necessary sacrifices — at least that is what the people who worship the moon once firmly believed.

materials.name: Radiant Exoskeleton
materials.desc:
A giant piece of bone that glows coldly, taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
These beasts blessed by the ancient power of the moon are able to manipulate their exoskeletons through the light that has soaked into their marrow over long years. Even though their bones float apart from their bodies, they can still command them at will like any other physical part.

materials.name: Precision Drive Shaft
materials.desc:
The drive shaft of a Landcruiser refined by the Design Bureau.
On the blueprints drawn by the engineers of the north, this unassuming part was once the flawless embodiment of glory and technological advancement, its small metal body encapsulating the wisdom of countless generations. Now it lies in the cold dirt, waiting to be recycled once more.

materials.name: Mora
materials.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

materials.name: Aureate Radiance of the Far-North Scions
materials.desc:
Weapon Ascension Material.
With the unblessed birth of the prophesied son, a millennia-long plan ushered in a bleak twilight.
A scheme born of cunning was shattered by foolish betrayal. The youth who was supposed to be king took the maid who was supposed to serve him and stole the secret treasure that was supposed to be his, only to reject the crowns that fate had ordained for him.
In time, the king who was destined to rule Elysium went down in history as an unpardonable thief, and by the time the true new moon shone upon the land, the far north's final wish of golden grandeur had already been buried by a priestess, who had never believed in any god, in the empty grave of her king.

materials.name: Radiant Exoskeleton
materials.desc:
A giant piece of bone that glows coldly, taken from the exterior of a glowing beast.
These beasts blessed by the ancient power of the moon are able to manipulate their exoskeletons through the light that has soaked into their marrow over long years. Even though their bones float apart from their bodies, they can still command them at will like any other physical part.

On the blueprints drawn by the engineers of the north, this unassuming part was once the flawless embodiment of glory and technological advancement, its small metal body encapsulating the wisdom of countless generations. Now it lies in the cold dirt, waiting to be recycled once more.
